## How should you name files? {.center}

<span class="italic"><h3 style="color:black">Here are 6 things to remember.</h3></span>

![](./images/img9.png){fig-align="center" width=70% height=70%} 

# 

## 1. Use a name that describes and uniquely identifies the file contents {.incremental}


![](./images/img10.png){.fragment fig-align="right" width=70% height=70%} 
![](./images/img11.png){.fragment fig-align="center" width=70% height=70%} 
![](./images/img12.png){.fragment fig-align="center" width=70% height=70%} 
![](./images/img13.png){.fragment fig-align="center" width=70% height=70%} 


- **You can use descriptors like these in the name:** (1) project acronym, (2) location where data were collected,
(3) researcher name, (4) year or month collected, (5) type of data in file

## 2. Keep names as short as possible
<br>
<br>
<br>
<span class="italic"><h3 style= "font-family: Courier New; color:darkred; text-align:center"> < 25 characters </h3></span>


## 3. Avoid using spaces & special characters

<br>
<br>
<br>
<span class="italic"><h3 style= "font-family: Courier New; color:darkred; text-align:center"> $ % ^ & # | : , ; </h3></span>

<br>
<br>
<br>
<h4 style= "color:black; text-align:center"> Computer programs interpret these characters as special instructions, spaces, or breakpoints. </h4>




## 4. Start with letters, never numbers

<br>
<br>
<br>
<h3 style= "font-family: Courier New; color:darkred; text-align:center"> 1998_data </h3>
<h3 style= "color:black; text-align:center"> NO </h3>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<h3 style= "font-family: Courier New; color:darkred; text-align:center"> data_1998 </h3>
<h3 style= "color:black; text-align:center"> YES </h3>


## 5. Include dates in names (but be careful!){.incremental}



![](./images/img14.png){fig-align="center" width=70% height=70%} 

![](./images/img15.png){.fragment fig-align="center" width=70% height=70%} 

- **This can lead to major problems when collaborating internationally or 
when team members use versions of software from different global regions.**




## 6. Dates in names: use standard format
<h3 style= "color:navyblue; text-align:center">  (ISO 8601)^[International Organization for Standardization] </h3>


![](./images/img16.png){fig-align="center" width=90% height=90%} 

## Bonus from doing 5 & 6

<span class="italic"><h4 style="color:black; text-align:left">In addition to avoiding confusion, you can now quickly sort files chronologically.</h4></span>


::: {layout-ncol=2 .fragment .column1 width="30%"}

Characters are read and sorted in order, so  files with “4 April” in the name will be sorted after those with “5 April”, regardless of the year….

![](./images/img17.png){fig-align="center" width=35% height=35%} 

…but not when you use ISO format, which puts the year first.

![](./images/img18.png){fig-align="center" width=35% height=35%} 


:::
